ygData.subject: Re: Re: 1H or 2H
ygData.msgSnippet: Taunt is ineffective if your casters are dealing to much damage with spells. They do large amounts of damage in a short time keeping a mobs attention. The
ygData.messageBody:
Taunt is ineffective if your casters are dealing to much damage with spells.
They do large amounts of damage in a short time keeping a mobs attention.

The reason the 2 hs is better in a group is if the wiz controls himself in
the early parts of combat you can keep a mob taunted on you the whole time
because of the damage you are dealing with your big sword.

Then when the wizzie kicks in the heavy damage the mob takes off running.
So in the perfect combat you take all the damage...cleric only has one
person to heal...and the group moves on to the next combat faster.

It also helps that you do the pulling as well. Keep a bow on hand for
pulling from a distance.

My $.02

Bael



-----Original Message-----
From: Patricia Halas <patty_halas@...>
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, October 18, 1999 10:14 AM
Subject: [warriors_eq] Re: 1H or 2H


>From: "Patricia Halas" <patty_halas@...>
>
>I must agree. I am a warrior in her 25th season, and generally use my
>langseax of wolves for my 2H weapon (normally get hits in the 40s and once
a
>crit of 99), but I get my 1H skills max'ed out for the better weapons I
hope
>to get in the future. It also seems to help my taunt when I am using dual
>langseax 1H swords and taunting, that almost always gets the mob off a
>caster no matter what spells he is using.
>
>So in closing. Keep your 1H and 2H skills max'ed along with slam/bash and
>kick and keep on fighting!
>
>Patricia Bryan
>Princess of the Bryan Dynasty
>Dynasty Guild, Bristlebane Server
>
>>For the Honor and Glory of the Warlord, Rallos Zek!
